wwpy.ww_data

Main interface module for WWINP file manipulation. Provides the WWData class for high-level operations on weight window data.

Classes

WWData()

Main interface for WWINP file manipulation.
class WWData[source]

Bases: object

Main interface for WWINP file manipulation.

High-level interface for manipulating weight window data from WWINP files.

Variables:

  • header (Header) – Weight window file header information

  • mesh (Mesh) – Mesh geometry and binning information

  • values (WeightWindowValues) – Weight window values container

multiply(factor=2.0)[source]

Multiply all weight window values by a specified factor.

Parameters:

factor (float) – Multiplication factor to apply

Example:
>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> wwinp.multiply(2.0)  # Double all weight window values
Return type:

None

soften(power=0.6)[source]

Adjust weight window values by applying a power transformation.

Parameters:

power (float) – Exponent to apply (< 1 softens, > 1 hardens)

Example:
>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> wwinp.soften(0.6)  # Soften weight windows
Return type:

None

query_ww(**kwargs)[source]

Query weight window values based on specified criteria.

Parameters:

kwargs (dict) – Query parameters passed to WeightWindowValues.query_ww()

Returns:

Object containing queried values and metadata

Return type:

QueryResult

Example:
>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> result = wwinp.query_ww(
...     particle_type=0,
...     energy=(1.0, 10.0),
...     x=(0, 10),
...     y=(0, 10),
...     z=(0, 10)
... )
apply_ratio_threshold(**kwargs)[source]

Apply a ratio threshold to weight window values.

Parameters:

kwargs (dict) – Parameters passed to WeightWindowValues.apply_ratio_threshold()

Example:
>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> wwinp.apply_ratio_threshold(
...     threshold=10.0,
...     particle_types=[0],
...     verbose=True
... )
Return type:

None

write_file(filename)[source]

Write the WWINP data to a file in FORTRAN-compatible format.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Path where the output file will be written

Return type:

None

__init__()
Return type:

None
